job_title: Assistant Professor, Humanities in Norton, MA
pros: Wheaton has a kind and congenial campus environment unrivaled by any other school at which I have taught. The faculty do an immense service to their students, the relationship between faculty and the administration is productive and transparent, and the campus is beautiful. It's simply a fantastic school at which to work.
cons: I am underpaid and we are under-resourced, and I feel that my opportunities to increase my earnings are few and far between. I am torn because Wheaton's smart management of its money is one of the things I like about working here -- we aren't caught in the race to build multi-million dollar athletics complexes. But at the same time I do think faculty are not sufficiently compensated compared to peer institutions (and even to some institutions that are not our peers!)
